I'm recently "permanently disabled" and have had many, many health issues to deal with. Prior to that, I have worked in the nursing field, teaching/training about Von Willebrand's disease (lots of travel involved), I've worked in the banking/finance industry, taught Home Economics to Jr. High students @ a Christian school and raised 4 children. I'm just past 40 now and enjoying my Grandbabies, and trying to pursue a lifelong dream of writing. I have had many small "home based" businesses over the last 20 years and enjoyed all of them. The thing I loved most was always meeting new people.
Working on personal website... for now MySpace listed below (Facebook under same name) and Follow me on Twitter: Susi Prola

• To reach 50,000 poor women and families in during fy 10-11, 60% of them would be from poorest and poor families, 40% from old age, differently able and destitute.
•  Provide life skills training such as planning for better business, HIV/AIDS, learning games for adolescent girls, vermi composting, mushroom/vegetable cultivation etc. 
• Provide products & services - credit, linkage of organic farming, marketing, packaging, processing, and their entitlement benefits. 
•  Improve well being – increase income of a supported family by Rs. 1000/- per month. Reduce health expenditure of family by Rs. 500/- and increase enrollment of children to the school.
lenders.occupational_info:
The PSVK was started by help of few social workers to initiate unique model of social work, Self Help Group Creation, formal education and computer education through community participation first in Patna district of Bihar and further replicated in other district of Bihar and Jharkhand.
 PSVK visualizes to create a value added society based on social justice, unity, integrity, equality, peace trust and freedom through community organization, participation and empowerment by providing equal access to right to food, clothing, shelter, education, health and information

lenders.name: shannon
lenders.occupation: stay at home mommy/ jewelry maker

lenders.name: Sacha
lenders.loan_because:
My hope is that an economically sound injection of capital (i.e. a loan) into poor communities will ripple in the local economy, resulting in a large benefit for a small investment. My money and my absorption of the risk of these loans allows the process to happen faster than before.

I also believe that Kiva, and microlending in general, is not a substitute for charity or government-based initiatives aimed at helping those in need. Instead, Kiva bridges the gap between the needs of the destitute and the needs of the middle class.
lenders.occupational_info: I run my company's IT department.

lenders.name: Dirk
lenders.loan_because: To help others get a start or improve their situation.
lenders.occupational_info: I design offshore deepwater oil and gas production platforms.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a tremendous way to support the entrepreneurial spirit of those around the world who have the courage to turn their unique talents and skills into a livelihood.
lenders.occupational_info: Connecting people and organizations that can achieve things together that they could never achieve separately.

lenders.name: TheBolvins

lenders.occupational_info: She's a high school teacher, he's a network administrator,  and the kids are just ... kids!
